metadata.title: Advanced Week 10 — Monday (Day 1)
keyFeatures: Maximal intensity, minimal volume (6 total reps)

structuredWorkout.title: Lower: Squat Emphasis
structuredWorkout.description: Week 2 of peaking: Handling loads very close to 1RM to prepare CNS and confidence for competition. 92.5% 1RM for 3 sets of 2 reps. First rep should move with decent speed; second rep will slow significantly (expected at 92.5%). If second rep stalls or grinds excessively (>6sec), reduce weight 10lbs next set. All accessories eliminated except light maintenance to maximize recovery for Thursday's deadlifts.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Critical preparation for 92.5% squats — deliberate and confidence-building

exercises.name: Light Cardio
exercises.notes: Bike or row — purely for temperature increase

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Hip circles, leg swings, 90/90 stretches — hips and ankles must be fluid

exercises.name: Build-Up Sets (The Peaking Ladder)
exercises.notes: Example for 400lb 1RM (370lb working weight): Bar×10, 135×5, 185×3, 225×2, 275×1, 315×1, 345×1, then 370×2. Every warm-up rep must be identical to competition form.

exercises.name: Competition Squat (High-Bar or Low-Bar)

intensity.description: 92.5% 1RM — Heavy doubles. Second rep should be hard but clean. If stalling (>6sec), reduce 10lbs.

exercises.tempo: Controlled descent, 0.5s pause, maximal explosive drive
exercises.notes: Setup: Maximum tightness—big breath (fill belly and brace), upper back locked (squeeze bar into traps), approach bar with total confidence. Walkout: 2-3 steps max, no repositioning (save every ounce of energy). Execution: Descend with control (2-3sec), hit depth (parallel or below—don't cut depth to save energy), pause 0.5sec at bottom (maintain tension), DRIVE through floor. First rep should move with decent speed; second rep will slow significantly—this is normal. If second rep stalls or you question depth, reduce weight 10lbs next set. Rest 4-5min (sit down between sets, mentally reset). Record: weight, reps completed, RPE, bar speed on each rep (first vs second), depth confidence. This data informs Week 11 openers.

sections.title: Secondary Maintenance
sections.overview: Light movement to maintain pattern without fatigue

exercises.name: Front Squat OR High-Bar Squat

intensity.description: 55-60% back squat 1RM — Active recovery, NOT training

exercises.notes: Very light. Purely to maintain movement pattern and blood flow after the heavy sets. Focus on smoothness and depth.

exercises.name: Light Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Extremely light. Keep the posterior chain moving without adding fatigue for Thursday.

exercises.name: Quad/Hip Flexor Stretch
exercises.notes: Gentle, no aggressive stretching when neurally fatigued

exercises.name: Visualization
exercises.notes: Sit quietly. Visualize Thursday's deadlifts at 92.5% moving perfectly.

structuredWorkout.title: Upper: Bench Emphasis
structuredWorkout.description: Week 2 of peaking: Handle 92.5% 1RM for doubles. Setup is everything at this weight—feet planted, arch locked, shoulder blades retracted and pinned. Spotter present and attentive is non-negotiable. First rep should move with control; second rep will slow significantly but must complete without stalling. Accessories reduced to maintenance to preserve CNS for Thursday.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Shoulder and upper back preparation for maximal pressing

exercises.name: Light Cardio
exercises.notes: Arm circles and band pull-aparts during cardio

exercises.name: Band Pull-Aparts
exercises.notes: Activate rear delts and scaps for stability

exercises.name: Build-Up Sets (Precision Jumps)
exercises.notes: Example for 300lb 1RM (275-280lb working weight): Bar×10, 95×5, 135×3, 185×2, 225×1, 255×1, then 277.5×2. Use spotter for last 2 warm-ups.

exercises.name: Competition Bench Press

intensity.description: 92.5% 1RM — Heavy doubles. Second rep will be slow; if bar stalls or requires spotter assistance, weight is too heavy.

exercises.tempo: 2 sec descent, 0.5 sec pause, maximal explosive drive
exercises.notes: Setup: Perfect setup is everything—feet planted (drive through floor during press), arch locked in, shoulder blades pinned, grip secure (chalk if needed). Spotter MUST be present—communicate liftoff cues clearly. Execution: Unrack (spotter assists liftoff to save energy), position over sternum, big breath and brace, lower with control (2sec), touch lightly, pause 0.5sec, press explosively (drive bar up and slightly toward face). Rest 4-5min. Record: weight, reps, RPE, bar speed (first vs second), arch stability, confidence level.

sections.title: Secondary Maintenance
sections.overview: Minimal upper work for shoulder health and pattern maintenance

exercises.name: Close-Grip Bench Press
exercises.notes: Very light. Maintain triceps/lockout pattern without fatigue.

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.notes: Keep the shoulders healthy. Essential even in peaking.

exercises.name: Chest/Shoulder Stretch
exercises.notes: Gentle doorway stretch

metadata.title: Advanced Week 10 — Thursday (Day 4)
keyFeatures: Singles preferred if first rep is RPE 9.5+
Maximum CNS demand — full rest between sets (5 min)
All accessories eliminated — focus only on the pull

structuredWorkout.title: Lower: Deadlift Emphasis
structuredWorkout.description: Week 2 of peaking: Deadlifts at 92.5% are exceptionally demanding. Many lifters only perform singles (3x1) at this intensity. If first rep is RPE 9.5 or slow (>4sec), do NOT attempt second rep. Setup must be perfect—bar over mid-foot, shins vertical, lats engaged, big breath and brace (360). This is the most taxing session of the program.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Most thorough warm-up of the program — prepare for maximal pull

exercises.name: Light Cardio
exercises.notes: Leg swings and hip openers during cardio

exercises.name: Cat-Cow
exercises.notes: Mobilize spine, prepare for bracing

exercises.name: Build-Up Sets (The Heavy Ladder)
exercises.notes: Example for 500lb 1RM (460-465lb working weight): 135×5, 225×3, 315×2, 365×1, 405×1, 435×1, then 465×1-2. Warm-ups should feel 'fast'—if 435 feels slow, be conservative with 465.

exercises.name: Competition Deadlift (Conventional or Sumo)

intensity.description: 92.5% 1RM — Heavy singles/doubles. If first rep is >4sec, do NOT attempt second. Quality > Quantity.

exercises.tempo: Perfect setup, maximal explosive pull, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup (MOST CRITICAL): Feet hip-width (conventional) or wide (sumo), bar over mid-foot, shins vertical, grip secure (mixed or hook). Chest UP, lats engaged (pull slack out—bar should click), big breath and brace (360). Execution: Push floor away with legs (leg drive first), bar scrapes body entire lift, lockout with glutes (stand tall, don't lean back). Lower with control. If first rep is a grind (>4-5sec) or form breaks, STOP. Do not risk second rep. Rest 5min (release belt, sit down, mentally reset). Record: weight, reps (1 or 2?), RPE, bar speed (floor to lockout), grip stability, form notes (back round? hips shot up?).

sections.title: Maintenance Only
sections.overview: Minimal movement purely for blood flow

exercises.name: Light High-Bar Squat
exercises.notes: Extremely light. Maintaining the pattern after maximal deadlifts.

exercises.name: Child's Pose
exercises.notes: Relax the lower back after maximal loading

exercises.name: Light Walking
exercises.notes: Slow pace, just movement
